Reviews.Title: “Fine as a stop-over hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mariafromnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in late August as a stop-over. For the most part, it was fine. We had a family room, which consisted of a double bed and bunk beds in the room. The room itself was a good sized room, with a modern bathroom, and a balcony of sorts. There was air conditioning in the room, that worked very well indeed. In terms of drinking and dining, there was a garden bar, where we sat and had a drink. It was pleasant but for the few annoying wasps. We didn't have dinner in the hotel, and to be honest, i'm not sure the restaurant was open for dinner as there were rennovations being carried out during our stay. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and it was very good actually - a mix of hot and cold items - the usual things: cereals, yoghurts, pastries, sausages, eggs, bacon, cheese, cold meats, breads, tea, coffee, juice etc. It is a bit of a strange area by the airport so there weren't a lot of restaurants nearby to eat at in the evening we were there, but we did find one (the name of which I cannot remember, but it was about 5 mins walk from the hotel. The name of it translated roughly into something like 'happy times') and had pleasant enough food, including a full children's menu, which was great. There was no pool, which was a shame as the kids would have loved a swim - but again, it was only for one night. They offer a free shuttle bus to and from the airport - and it's a regular, reliable service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay close to Bajares Airport in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Julian S
Reviews.Content: In order to connect from the Sevilla-Madrid AVE high speed-train from Sevilla to my flight to Baltimore, I had to spend the night in Madrid close to the airport, as i have done before. This was the first time in this hotel and it was by far the most satisfactory. It's a 4* hotel, not the newest, but in nice shape. The breakfast buffet was OK. The airport shuttle service was efficient and operated more hours than some of the other hotels near-by. My only complaint is that the wifi was to weak in my room to connect and I had to go down to the lobby to get Internet connection. Except for this I would have rated the Hotel as excellent for what it is: an overnight hotel by the airport for mostly business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: We travelled on 17.7.12 having only booked this holiday the day before so not much time to research properly! There is a free shuttle bus from the airport which was handy but we were told we had to call the hotel first - I think Reception may sometimes need to prompt the driver that someone is waiting! But it only took 10 minutes to arrive and around 5 mins to take us to the hotel. Although near the airport we heard no noise at all from aircraft. In fact the room was very quiet - couldn't hear our neighbours at all! We had a standard room but I believe there are different types - some even had gym equipment in! The standard rooms are reasonably spacious with a very nice bathroom (full bath and shower, wash basin/vanity unit, toilet and bidet). There is a free safe and good size TV but we could only find one English speaking channel - BBC World News. Not a great deal of drawer space but adequate. You can tell the hotel is more geared to business travellers than tourists. We were told there would be tea and coffee in the room but there wasn't. We asked at Reception and they promised to sort it but nothing materialised. We also asked them to check the air conditioning as we couldn't adjust it but again nothing happened [it reached 43 degrees whilst we were in Madrid so we wanted it turned up!] On a more positive note when we arrived one of the wardrobe doors was jammed meaning we couldn't access the safe - Reception sent a man up straight away who fixed that problem there and then. The beds were comfortable but we found the hollow fibre pillows uncomfortable. Also whilst there was a spacious balcony there was no furniture which was a disappointment - none of the other rooms had patio furniture either which we found strange. We'd booked for breakfast each morning which we were told by the booking agent was continental but as well as the usual cold meats, salamis, cheeses etc there were also fried, boiled and scrambled eggs, bacon (albeit Spanish style), sausages and mushrooms. Plus there was a nice selection of fruit, cereals, yogurts, pastries, cakes and even churros with chocolate sauce. We didn't eat any other meals at the hotel but we did notice they offered a variety of evening meals including a range of tapas for a rvery easonable price. The main issue for us was the distance the hotel was from the centre of Madrid. We found the easiest and quickest way into central Madrid (the 'Sol' district) is by the Metro although there did also seem to be a lot of buses about too. The nearest Metro station is about a 20 minute walk away (Barajas Station). The Metro system is very cheap and there are plenty of free maps to help you. It's similar to the London underground with colour coded numbered lines. The Barajas station has a ticket office so just tell them the station you want and they will give you the ticket. The Metro is very spacious, clean and efficient. It takes 2 trains to get to the centre of Madrid roughly 30 minutes travelling, possibly 3 trains if going farther afield but you never have to wait more than a couple of minutes for any connection. It also appeared very safe from what we saw. Nor was it overcrowded but as we were there in July it's possible many spanish were on holiday themselves. In summary, the hotel was ok apart from a few niggles but I dpon't recommend it if you're wanting to explore the city. Get a hotel nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, good food overall pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Pheephox
Reviews.Content: was put up here by the airline when missing flight connection and very pleasantly surprised. Very good standard for airport hotel. Staff a little brusque, possibly due to checking in lots of people in my situation, but decent service, good buffet food and rooms although smallish are very very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmcc752_12
Reviews.Content: Having to call the hotel for the transport is a little difficult. The wait for the bus was longer than anticipated - but after that everything went smoothly. The reception staff were very helpful, the room was excellent, and the breakfast buffet was fine. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Madrid for more than 2 years”
Reviews.Author: chucho_nordes
Reviews.Content: I travel to Madrid every 15 days for business reasons and if I have to stay near the airport Tryp Alameda is always my choice. And it has been so for more than two years! The staff makes me feel at home, they are remarkably friendly. The breakfast buffet is very good and the lunch menu even better, great quality food with style for a popular price. The rooms are spacious, you are allowed to use Melia's pool during the summer and the tube is 7 min walking just down the road. Try the terrace for lunch or a coffee, you will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravelerApex_NC
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a Madrid airport hotel that could accommodate our family of 5, and had free shuttle. We had 2 rooms (one for 2 people, one for 3). The rooms were very modern and clean, and exceeded our expectations! We returned our rental car to the airport that evening, and were told to call the hotel when we were ready for the shuttle to bring us back to the hotel. The shuttle arrived within about 5 minutes. We ate dinner in the bar area. The food was great! We had a 7am flight the next morning, so we were told to go to the lobby 30 minutes before we wanted to be at the terminal. We were in the lobby at 5am and the shuttle came shortly after that. We were at the airport by 5:20! The staff at the front desk spoke good English. My only regret is that we didn't have more time to enjoy this hotel. We would definitely recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very decent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: otzberg
Reviews.Content: Airport Hotels rarely are exceptional and they rarely need to be. In my books a good airport hotel needs to offer only three virtues: close to the airport, frequent airport shuttle, clean rooms - everything else is a bonus. I ended up in this hotel after missing my flight connection and was subsequently "assigned" to this hotel by Iberia. Upon leaving the airport building, the shuttle was waiting for passengers and got us to our destination in a quick and efficient manner. Check on one of my virtues. The front desk staff didn't speak a lot, a quiet, kind of slow chap, who got the job done. An ok experience. The room was surprisingly large, well equipped, decent TV and more importantly free wifi internet in the room. I was pleasantly surprised that there was no aircraft noise at all in this location and that is a real boon for an airport hotel. The bathroom was a good size and very clean, as was the rest of the room. Check on the second one of my virtues. If you venture outside the hotel you'll find a bunch of small bars, a supermarkets and more all in very easy walking distance, so you don't need to feel locked up. The airline had paid for dinner and breakfast, so I "enjoyed" both meals. While dinner left me wanting, breakfast was wonderful with a very good selection. I am not sure I would have been happy to pay for dinner (average), but breakfast would have been a decent investment (above average for Spain, I'd say). When I was ready to leave at 7am the shuttle was yet again waiting for passengers and got me to the airport. Check on the last of my three virtues. So my key requirements were fulfilled very well: easy transport to and from the airport, just about 5-10 minutes by shuttle bus reasonably large, clean and comfortable rooms without aircraft noise a good night's sleep, decent breakfast Even though I didn't pay for this hotel myself, I would have been happy to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “My favorit Airport hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Hans-Germany
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my favorit Airport hotel at Madrid Barajas. I´m coming there since years. Bestvalue for money, excellent rooms, clean, friendly staff, quiet. The free shuttle bus from/to the airport is an added value. Excellent for business and leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi, no excuse, average room”
Reviews.Author: Olelie
Reviews.Content: The room itself was ok although a little worn. What annoyed me big time though was that the room had no wifi. Appearantly none of the rooms have. At least thats what I was told when I called to complain. They seem to have wifi in the reception area, that was the only excuse I was offered when I mentioned that it was promised on the booking papers that the hotel AND THIS ROOM should have wifi. There is no excuse for such false advertising. There are several other airport hotels at Barajas so never again for me here.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel let down by service”
Reviews.Author: DON445
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel while working in Madrid, when we arrived it took 45minutes to check in, this wasn't due to any booking issue just 45 minutes of the receptionist typing and scanning documents. Overall spent very little time in the hotel, it was clean and comfy as well as having a good shower, just as you would expect from any airport hotel. Although it advertises itself as an airport hotel it can take upto 20minutes to get to the airport so you will need to allow extra time for your journey.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, rubbish Internet”
Reviews.Author: GrahamIX
Reviews.Content: Here for a one night stay for meetings at the airport. Despite it being such a short visit, I was actually struggling with huge cases - but a 4* hotel had no-one to help with luggage? Really? No power adaptors. Annoying but possible to run out. But there is no wifi. They have wired internet but when I called down to reception woman was rude and appeared to hang up on me. Corridor where I was checked in is a building site.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and very good”
Reviews.Author: LiliNapoli
Reviews.Content: Despite the small entrance, this hotel is great. The check in is fast. The room is large and quiet, with very good beds and bathroom. Dinner almost tasty.

Reviews.Title: “value & close to airport”
Reviews.Author: plq1975
Reviews.Content: Ok, lets just make one thing clear. this is not the hotel you pick for a Madrid vacation. It's located in Barajas, a few minutes from the airport. They have a free shuttle that runs every 10 minutes and there are a decent number of restaurants and supermarkets within walking distance from the hotel. The rooms are clean and in pretty good shape. Wifi included in the room price (approx € 65) Stay here if you need to be close to the airport or wish to visit Barajas. If not, I think there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected stay”
Reviews.Author: move_israel
Reviews.Content: Our 20:15 evening flight from Barcelona to Madrid was surprisingly canceled, so we had to wait 2 more hours in the airport and missed our connecting flight. When we arrived to Barajas Madrid airport, the customer service sent us to the Alameda, 20 minutes away for a gratis dinner and accommodation. This is not my first time to “enjoy” hotels, gratitude of an airline. However it worked really well for us. The room was nice and clean. For an emergency situation like this, it was pretty good. Towels were long and pampering, Soap was state of the art and sleeping quality, under the circumstances, was good. Pity that the dinner at midnight was disappointing. No coffee or any other hot drink after a long and tiring journey. No staff to assist. The buffet looked tired. We needed something more homey. Even at breakfast the hot milk was less than warm and the staff was not the pleasant you expected. Oh well. The flight was right on time and this overnight is now just a memory.

Reviews.Title: “A typical airport hotel - between average and good”
Reviews.Author: WiP
Reviews.Content: I would probably not have chosen this hotel as a tourist destination, but thanks to a cancelled flight, the airline put me up in this hotel in Barajas, close to the airport. Cleary a hotel for airline crews, travel groups on their way to or from somewhere that need to spend a night before, sports teams, and perhaps also the one or other business traveller. I arrived on a Sunday night, quick checkin, despite quite a few people standing in line. Walking up to my room, I was not too impressed. The corridor looked as if it had not been vacuumed for several days and this was clearly a "smokers floor". But then room came as a nice surprise. Big bed, big TV, adequately sized desk that allowed for some work, a balcony and a well groomed bathroom. On the downside of this hotel: no wifi in the rooms (but you can get an ethernet cable at the reception, and there is WiFi in and near the bar-area). The restaurant is clearly designed to move the masses: generally a buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner, quite a nice selection of dishes, but not of the quality that would make you come especially for eating there. There is also a small, clean, fitness room with three or four machines. In short: this hotel was efficient in trying to get done what had to be done, with few staff. I slept well, it was actually very quiet at night. The hotel is perhaps a 10 minute walk from the subway station, and there is regular free shuttle service to and from the airport. I have stayed in far worse airport hotels, so this was a GOOD hotel for that purpose, but if were to stay in Madrid for a few work or leisure days, I would pick another one next time I-m there (see also the foots).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for Money”
Reviews.Author: GauravCreations
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 friends who stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. We had booked a family room for EUR 135 per night including breakfast. The hotel provided ariport pickup and drop service. Drop facility was also provided for the Madrid City Centre. The room was very comfortable and in excellent condition. Our room was actually decorated based on the Spiderman theme! All in all it was a very pleasant stay. Read about our Madrid Trip http://www.cafeinks.com/archives/1180/madrid-the-city-with-an-artistic-heritage

Reviews.Title: “Didn´t have another choice, OK for overnight”
Reviews.Author: AnneTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: Thiis an ¨Iberian¨hotel, everyday busy with customers that missed their connection, and therefore customer service and quality is basic, they will always have customers anyway, so why make an effort. Restarurant VERY BAD Receprion OK Rooms OK Ammenities OK Airport Shuttle OK Restaurant, waiters are so unfriendly, even for Spanish standards. Meals just basic, no drinks included, just tap water. We didnt have a choice, but i wouldn´t stay here is not a 4 star hotel )more like a 2-3 star)

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in between the flights.”
Reviews.Author: Helen34438
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at Amelida, because I had missed my connection flight. It is located about 10-15 minutes by a free shuttle from the airport. The front desk was very pleasant and spoke perfect English. My room was a good size, but a bit dated. The king bed was not very comfortable to sleep on and the pillows were a "sausage style" and too soft. The bathroom had everything you would need tho. Breakfast and lunch were delicious. There was some kind of weird story with the internet... I paid for 24 hours, but I could only use my laptop ( and no Ipad or Iphone)because I had to plug the cable in. Oveall I had a good and relaxing stay before my next flight.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: citizenMcDermott
Reviews.Content: When our Iberia flight was delayed until the next morning, Iberia provided us with an overnight stay at this hotel. Naturally, we thought, it's an airport hotel and it's being comped by the airline so it'll probably be a bed and shower place that allows pets (we were travelling with two dogs). First of all, the hotel upgraded us, after asking, to their premium room. The room was very spacious, had a lovely bathroom with tub/shower which included toiletries, a king-size bed with comfortable body pillows and high-count bed sheets. We had a large balcony with two chairs for sitting while enjoying the city view (Madrid was pretty far off in the distance, though). Because we were so tired, we decided to order room service rather than venture out to one of the restaurants. The room service menu was quite extensive and when the food arrived 30 minutes later, it was all delicious. The breakfast buffet the next morning was a bit better than I expected as well. Typical European style breakfast with a good selection of fruits and some Spanish items (Tortilla de Patata). If it hadn't been for Iberia, we never would have stayed at this hotel. But, if we ever have to overnight in Barajas again, this is definitely one of the places we'd choose.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight only”
Reviews.Author: stebbimar
Reviews.Content: Benn here 3 times due to overnight.. shuttle bus irregular, had to wait 30 min in the airport after calling them...this is somewhat normal in Spain. staff and check-in ok bar staff lacking, short of staff I guess but helpful when there breakfast is terrible, nothing edible..this is somewhat normal in Spain also in a low to mid budget hotel. Room ok and clean, air conditioning not sufficient in the summer. Bed and bathroom average Internet ok (cable and code from lobby) Otherwise not a bad choice for an overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you need a place to stay before going to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Rubo82
Reviews.Content: Thanks to my friends from Iberia Airlines (also known as the worst airline in earth), I had to spend a night in this hotel. They provide a shuttle service from the aiport which runs every 20 minutes and takes you to the hotel in around 15 minutes: really convenient. It is for free. I really liked the girls in the reception desk: super friendly and helpful...they seem to be quite used to cope with angry passangers who got their plans ruined. My room was spacious, not so new, but in really good conditions. Beds are really comfortable, there is huge tv with channels in all the main languages and and the toilet is clean and well equipped. They even provide some toiletries that you may not get in other hotels anymore. Dinner was just ok: enough to get a salad and some cold stuff like sausages, cheese, fruit...warm buffet was quite poor. On the other hand, I really liked breakfast: different types of bread, fresh juices, serrano ham among other sausages, lots of fruit, oil and tomate for those looking for a really Spanish breakfast, pastries which looked quite good but I didnt try...among other warm things that I don't usually eat that early. I would repeat if I need to go to Barajas early in the morning, but I hope my beloved Iberia does not force me to do so again :).

Reviews.Title: “A cosy view of the world”
Reviews.Author: tbs4real
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for a lady or ladies... It has very big hair dryer in the bathroom. I would recommend this hotel... Airport shuttle, good reception though you really are on ur own. Comfortable rooms with good view. Cant really say if the location is central or not, that wud depend on ur choice of activities in madrid. lest i forget.....very many variety for breakfast, and the breakfast room is huge!

Reviews.Title: “A functional transit point for airport travellers.”
Reviews.Author: Neildavidson
Reviews.Content: Iberia managed to oversell the return flight from Madrid, so put me up in this hotel until the flight next morning. As a freebie for passengers who are unable to catch a flight due to airline inefficiency, this is exactly what you would expect. It is functional but you would not like to stay more than one night. The restaurant is self service with tepid food- chicken fillets and indeterminate fish. Cold chips. The room is comfortable and like every other airport Hotel. Soulless. The chances are you wont have a choice if you wind up at this Hotel, as Iberia use it for their hapless passengers. If you have a choice, go into Madrid proper and experience the City.

Reviews.Title: “Never again with kids”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room while we had to fly early in the morning from Barajas. The room is ok but the bathroom was not very clean. We stayed there with two kids of 5 en 2 years old. We would expect the way it was advertised that they expect families in their hotel but we didn't feel welcome at all because both children weren't alowed to walk around a bit in a EMPTY bar/cafetaria. We went to our room and didn't came out until early in the morning. For family we wouldn't recommend this hotel, for business it's ok. We payed a lot of money for the room incl. breakfast we didn't even used because we left very early...never again!

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dreamings3232
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest hotel I stayed in during my time in Europe :-D Definitely top of the line place. The room was extremely comfortable & had a huge large closet & bathroom & a balcony overlooking the parking Lot and other balconies. There was a huge flat screen TV, a large desk, a nice silk chair with coffee table. The bathroom was just luxurious. I loved the stay there. The breakfast was a typical breakfast with cereal and hot meals. Oh and there is a gym as well for the gym fanatics :-D

Reviews.Title: “Great food”
Reviews.Author: badiisa
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect for meetings, not only because the meeting rooms are great, but because of the FOOD... Yes, the food at this hotel is very inventive and yummy, from the breakfast buffet, to lunches that are simply delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricky_NewDelhi_India
Reviews.Content: Was in this hotel for a day when my Luftansa flight got cancelled. Was some 10 mins. drive from the hotel. Thought free shuttle from airport is provided here, had to wait for half an hour on the night I arrived and almost an hour the next day. The rooms were chic and bed comfortable. Everything including the meals were paid by the airline. The dinner as well as the breakfast next day were buffet but wholesome. They should have put names of dishes which I found very confusing. Wine was included in the menu as well. Didn't know abou the metro available some 10 mins. walk away, so caught it from the airport after taking the shuttle bus early in the morning. Overall, enjoyed the free stay here and the wonderul city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Madrid conference venue”
Reviews.Author: bobchamb
Reviews.Content: Had a very positive stay - clean and comfortable bedroom, good meeting room facilities, delicious food, and friendly helpful service. Convenient location for the airport and easy public transport into the centre. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality airport hotel with top staff and good food”
Reviews.Author: Brixtonesque
Reviews.Content: I organised a conference in this airport hotel (which we had chosen for its handy location from Barajas - a 10-minute free shuttle bus ride from the terminals, run 24/7), and I was very impressed in the end: the staff could not have been more helpful, most of them spoke good English (and those who didn't were still smiley and efficient), the conference rooms were spacious and light, the bedrooms comfortable and spacious enough, and the food suprisingly delicious for such a "standard" airport hotel (we had 3-course lunches and buffet dinners and breakfasts for 3 days). Sound proofing in the bedrooms was very good, I didn't hear any plane noise at all. The only slight issues we had were with the internet connection (free only in the meeting rooms, otherwise fairly costly) and with the lack of outside space - there is a small terrace, but it is not big enough for having all conference meals there. The area isn't anything interesting, but there is a little square 10 minutes' walk away with a few nice cafes, and a taxi to central Madrid takes half an hour and costs about 25 euros. The Barajas metro stop is about 10 minutes' walk away too.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: Usually, I HATE airport hotels, surly staff (they'll never see you again), bad food and bad service. But I stayed at this hotel on the periphery of Madrid's Barajas Airport last week and it was great. Terrific food, smiling staff. The only drawback is that it is a bus ride from the terminals, but that's OK. I was at a conference and they could not do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel, close to airport but with access to city.”
Reviews.Author: janewdc
Reviews.Content: We chose this airport hotel because it's one of the few in the area that offer 24 hrs free shuttle to the airport and we had a very early flight out. The shuttle comes and goes every 15 min or so. The hotel is excellent. It has very beautiful, spacious rooms. It has a bar and a restaurant. It offers a variety of rooms depending on needs from fitness rooms to kids rooms. It offers lots of toiletries in the gorgeous bathrooms (shaving set, toothbrush, etc.), which also has a hair dryer of course and decently sized tub. The room has a minibar and safe, and there's cable internet available for extra cost. In the lobby there's also wi fi availabe for extra cost. The only problem is that at the time we arrived there was only one lady at the reception taking care of checking in customers and attending the phones so the poor lady was going crazy (she still managed to be nice despite having to face the grumpy customers). We had to wait a long time for our turn checking in so I hope the hotel takes note and hires someone else to work in the reception as well. The location is excellent, it's about 400 meters from the Barajas metro station so you can easily get into Madrid and since the hotel is not within the airport the surrounding area has a few restaurants and shops. If you're not arriving through their shuttle service print a google map of the hotel otherwise it's little hard to find since it's not exactly on Avenida Logrono but a little hidden. Overall, excellent hotel, really nice and I like the location.

Reviews.Title: “few hours there but very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: carlosochoa
Reviews.Content: My stay took place during the snow cancellations of December 2010. It was part of the compensation package by the airline. There is an airport shuttle from Barajas to the hotel, but you have to ask the reception in advance when you need to go from the hotel to the airport. Due to the snow cancellations, there was a long line to get the keys of your room. However, the staff kept their cool and were always helpful. The room itself was good, clean and quiet, but the wash room might have been about the same size of the sleeping area! Internet there is not for free, and is better to stay in the lobby for wireless. The dining room is at the back of the hotel, next to a patio. Due to the compensation scheme, fixed meals were given but they were satisfying. Overall, it is a good hotel and quite convenient if you need to stay overnight.

Reviews.Title: “At least the airline paid for us”
Reviews.Author: travelevers
Reviews.Content: Worn out airport hotel under renovation. Comfy beds. Free airport shuttle. No internet.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: fran07Belgium
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at Tryp Alameda fwith my family or on my own for conecting flights to South America. It is also a good choice to visit madrid: the Metro station is 400 mts away and the ride to Madrid's center only takes 20 minutes. The service and the queality have been consistent for the last years. The staff is nice, the rooms are modern and clean and the food at the cafeteria is ok. Breakfast buffet is excellent. I can recommend the hotel that has also a free shuttle service to all the airport terminals and you can use the pool of close hotel Barajas Melia

Reviews.Title: “Good location if need to spend one night by the airport”
Reviews.Author: rosannar
Reviews.Content: We had to stay over one night as our flight was changed, Assistance from Iberia amigo was great he was there at luggage belt waiting for us and went with us to hotel. Hotel is a walking distance from a metro station, that is if you dont mind walking like 15 minutes to it, if coming back late at night it is best to take a cab since some spots from the metro to hotel are very lonely and dark plus they only charge 5 euros and is worth it if you are coming back with packages , tired and late, is worth paying a day ticket to use the train and buses unlimited there is a sour note , the Driver from the shuttle bus was rude made the comment that if we were moving since we carry each a medium luggage and a carry on and the next day he asked that we moved the lugagges closer, i inform it to the hotel, dont know if they did something about it, hope they did and they reported it to the company so they change him, it was disrespectful to say that, besides he has a job because people like us are traveling to his country, needless to say I didnt even gave him a tip

Reviews.Title: “OK airport transfer hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgyn
Reviews.Content: hotel is just about OK, but only for overnight airport transfers, it was clean enough with high quality toiletries in room, but staff were really not too friendly, as with most airport hotels, the staff don,t care too much, because maybe they think you,ll never see them again, in this case they are right, i won,t be back. .hotel has a free bus service but give yourself time to get to the airport, no free Internet connection,and a poor bar , but there are a few bars near by, but i,d advice travelers to stay in their room as they were strange places with strange customers, also an Irish bar near by which is a joke, so if you need a shower and a bed its OK if a little expensive a .forgettable place, but it is an airport hotel and as such its ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need to be near airport”
Reviews.Author: kyrat
Reviews.Content: Had a layover in Madrid, flying out early the next morning. Found this hotel for I think $77 nearby. Start with the BAD: 1. They didn't seem to ahve a record of my reservation!! (After 20 hours of travel/delays- so I was extremeley exhausted). After a good 10 minutes of stressing out while they "checked" - they found it. To be entirely fair: this confusion may well have been HOTELS.COM's fault, not the hotels, but it still affected my perception of the stay. 2. Probably not fair because every single bed we had in Spain & Morocco was just as bad - but the bed was rock hard. (which made my BF happy, but me not so much). 3. The metro was a bit away (not unreasonably so, but for someone exhausted from travelling all day, plus rain, plus getting a bit lost, I ended up taking a taxi back) GOOD: -7 min. free shuttle to & from airport -Not just a smoke free room (that had last been used by a smoker, or shared a ventalation shaft w/ smokers) -- the entire FLOOR was smoke free. For someone used to Spain as a SMOKE FILLED space, this was very pleasing! -The bathroom was fantasic, a long tub. -Room was quite nice, good curtains to keep out the light. -Quiet, (though we did hear some guests in the hallway (who were making no effort to keep their voices down)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overnight stay for layover”
Reviews.Author: Ericashirin
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was fabulous for an overnight flight layover. It is about 15 minute from the airport with a frequently running free shuttle. When I came out of the airport, it was already there waiting for passengers. The hotel room was lovely, especially after a vacation of budget hotels- bathroom had all the amenities you could need, peaceful room and comfortable bed. The best part however is that the hotel is in a very short walking distance to a few restaurants, including a great tapas/wine bar, in the tranquil Baraga neighborhood. Doesn't have the feel of central Madrid but is actually quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucks with a capital S.”
Reviews.Author: acb98sm
Reviews.Content: 4* on which planet? When I checked in there was 1 receptionist and 15-20 people checking in. I stayed in one of the Tryps special fitness rooms, designed specifically for people too lazy to walk down the stairs to go to the gym. The walls in the room were paper thin. I could hear everything the people next door were saying. Not sure what they would have said if I had started running on my personal treadmill. After I went to the airport to drop off a hire car I waited for around 1 hour for the hotels 'courtesy' bus. During this time I got on a bus that said Tryp hotels. The driver took me to another Tryp hotel (Hotel Diana) close to the airport hotel. When he realised the mistake he shouted at me and shook his head. Then he reluctantly drove me back to the airport and not my hotel. Very unpleasant experience late at night. No wireless in the room. No cable to plug in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hollycorner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Arrived after midnight, there was a bit of a problem phoning the hotel as we couldn't get through on mobiles and it took ages to fathom the public telephones in the airport. The airport staff were not very helpful and taxis from the taxi rank refused to take us to the hotel. Once the shuttle bus arrived everything was fine. Room was great. We had bunkbeds for my 2 boys and presents. Bathroom was fantastic-marble and something you would expect in a 5 star hotel. Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “While working in Spain”
Reviews.Author: KeithK2
Reviews.Content: I'd rate it at three stars. It is close to the aeropuerto ( Barajas ), and not too far from Avenida Castillano at the center of downtown Madrid, which is pretty much the center of the nightlife. Once you're in Madrid proper, you're not far from the Prado, the Presidential Palace, Plaza Major ( with amazing frescos painted on the walls !)

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Iberia for free night and 3 meals”
Reviews.Author: Steveh3Texas
Reviews.Content: Iberia caused us to miss a connection in Madrid. After similar experiences in US, I expected the worse. Instead we got a free night in a 4 star hotel and 3 free meals. The hotel is very convenient to the airport with shuttles driving continuously. The hotel is 500 meters from a Metro station. In Madrid, a Metro station is golden. 1E gets you anywhere one way, so we went to the Sol area and had a great time walking the streets and park. The Metro rivals DC's --- very new, clean and safe. Many different lines. Since all of our meals were free at the hotel, we ate there. All meals are buffets and nothing to complain about. Even free wine with lunch and dinner. Restaurant folks were very nice. The front desk crew was a little more surly, probably tired of dealing with travelers that didn't want to be there. I would happily stay there again depending upon the rate. We had a very enjoyable free day in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “good for airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: tikkiSpain
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights due to flight cancellation. Hotel good, but disappointed with terrible pillows, unfriendly staff and certain internet sites barred (nothing sinister either!) One evening in the bar cost us more than the 2 night stay so be warned. We found a great little bar round the corner where we had breakfast and evening meal at reasonable cost. On the plus side, it was comfortable, clean, close to the metro station and a shuttle service to the airport in the early hours. - Not all bad!

Reviews.Title: “Close but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Tadtv
Reviews.Content: It's close to the airport, but the rooms are so scratched up from everyone staying just one night. I have never seen a hotel with more marks on the walls. Even switched rooms and next room was just as marked up. Tub/shower sprayed water all over. Hotel served its purpose though, Breakfast okay in basement.

Reviews.Title: “OK but you could find better!”
Reviews.Author: SuttsDublin
Reviews.Content: We were put up in this hotel by Iberia when our flight was delayed. It is a 4 star hotel but at the bottom end. The room was clean and they were able to facilitate our request for inter connecting rooms for our children. The buffet dinner & breakfast were fine. They did not provide face cloths in the room which was a problem for us as our luggage was stuck in the airport. The bed was excellent. Overall it was OK, you could do a lot worse. However you could stay in a lot nicer hotels around the airport such as the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit far from the metro”
Reviews.Author: ric_fer
Reviews.Content: This hotel it's an excelent option to stay near the airport or last night in madrid if the flight it's very early. To visit the city you loose lot of time metro and until it, because it's more than 10 minuts walk from the metro, and after that you need more at least 25minuts to be at Gran Via. The staff was excelent, they have dinner until late, i saw ppl dinner after the midnight. the shuttle is excelent service to the airport and from. If you checkout early the hotel have some natural orange juce, coffe or milk, with some cakes, i think that they shoud inform that on the checkin. The rooms are spacious with satelite tv, a fridge that are usefull to put some beers in hot days. In hour days i think in this kind of hotels the internet on the rooms shoud be free.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and convenient for early flight”
Reviews.Author: FromSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen as we had an early flight back home. It was very convenient. They have a shuttle every 20 minutes to and from the airport. Also the metro is just a 10 minute walk away, so you can go into town in 15 minutes for dinner in Madrid. We found the place to be clean, the bathtowels were brand new and the room was large. Only problem was the heating that wasn't individually controlled, so it was too warm for us. The staff from front desk were very helpful when available. Sometimes there was only one person at the reception, so we needed to wait quite a lot for their attention. Tryp Alameda wa better than you'd expect from an Airport Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable but pricy place to wait for a plane”
Reviews.Author: the_bruja_is_back
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the 60 euro a night IBIS next door was full up. so i had no choice but to shell out 123 euros for one night. I will admit though, it is swanky. no complaints. the interior is beautiful. the staff seemed friendly enough. except for the airport shuttle which I took. the man does not ask you where you want to get off, if you dont' speak up, he takes you to the wrong terminal and you have to take the bus to get to the place you're supposed to go. this happened to me and i was telling him to take to the other terminal and he siad too late now that i shoudl have mentioned it before. he was very rude and not even appologetic that i was so late i almost could have missed my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotle”
Reviews.Author: sisIreland
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with staff who want to provide a service, had a group stay for a week and no complaints. Service to the airport was on time and each request met.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Henri32
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very unfriendly. The hotel is very old; not cosy or 'cool sixties' old, but the building is in an old state. There is no option to use internet (no wifi, no computer there) so I had to take the metro to find an internet café. In relation to what they charge, it's definately not worth the money. Find yourself another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tryp Alameda Aeropuerto Great”
Reviews.Author: romeo16
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel Tryp Alameda Aeropuerto was fantastic!! Very clean, free shuttle, very close to airport. Spacious room and bathroom, comfortable beds. Metro about 15 minute walk from property. No complaints. Would stay again and recemmend to others.

Reviews.Title: “4 star? No way!”
Reviews.Author: Brazil 26 Couple
Reviews.Content: Picked that one because of location and free shuttle. Both worked fine, although front desk was NOT helpfull at all. Phoned the hotel and asked for a taxi to pick me up (on a nearby location), which was denied. She said they could only ask for taxi pick up at the hotel. Room was nice & clean. Breakfast OK. Only 1 paid-service internet PC. Not worth the $$$, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: ossy19
Reviews.Content: - Hotelroom was regular. A bit old, but okay. - No WIFI, only one computer to email, but it didn't work when we were there. - The hotel had an unpleasant smell - Lunch and breakfast was not very tastefull. - They were reconstructing the room further on the hall, which made a lot of noise - They charged me over 70 EUR for a 20 min, phone call within the EU (Netherlands)!!! Which costs them about 5 EUR. Their answer: taxes. Right! Conclusion: don't go there. There must be better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, close to the airport, flawless shuttle”
Reviews.Author: ackart
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King for one night. They dont have triples and we could easily fit 3. And this was the fanciest room I have stayed in. Terry robes, marble everywhere, tv speakers in the bathroom, very large size, Super comfy bed, Nice terrace, bamboo plant in the bath. I dont know If we got a nicer room because it was a King. One of the highlights was the Pizza delievery thing. You could order a pizza through the front desk and they put it on your bill. it was a reasonable price too and fast 20 min I believe. We didnt feel like walking around looking for a place. The shuttle was so fast and we got there plenty of time. (Had a 5:45 am flight on Ryanair) I booked this through the hotel website, they have specials if you click on specials for madrid. A calendar comes up.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some make out”
Reviews.Author: manuselk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after arriving late in Madrid Airport. This is not by any means a great hotel, but for a short stay it is absolutely fine. Staff were friendly and helpful, at check in and when faced with any requests. Transfer to the airport is easy, and the hotel is within walking distance of the metro to central Madrid. Rooms are ok if unspectacular, but, like the rest of the hotel, somewhat dated. The datedness actually quite appealed to me as I am a bit of a sucker for sixties and seventies architecture and styling. Hallways are a bit grubby. To be avoided is having a drink at the bar. The bar looks as dated and unspectacular as the rest of the hotel, but charges as if it is the hottest spot in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Madrid Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Matt
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is an excellent choice for an overnight stay at Madrid's Barajas Airport... Late night check-in was speedy ,friendly & efficient. Guest room was very comfortable & clean , not spacious , but certainly more than adequate for an overnight stay. . Appreciated the fact that the Restaurant dining room was still open at an late hour with a nice variety of selections.. Breakfast buffet left nothing to complaint about... Shuttle service was timely & efficient. In the past , overnighted at the "Melia Barajas Hotel" but for some reason was more comfortable at this Hotel , plus the fact that it was less expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: psychtobe
Reviews.Content: Either this place has recently been renovated or the other reviewers have different standards than I. Like others, we stayed here because of an early-morning outbound flight from MAD. The hotel is a bit hard to find because of some major freeway interchange construction. The parking is adequate, but can get crowded late at night. The lobby is bright, modern, and clean. There is a swanky bar area and a large business-y/lounge area for relaxing (and in Europe, smoking). The front desk staff was adequate and professional. They apologized when we called down for an extra towel and brought it up within 20 minutes. They speak some English, though not a lot. This is Spain, after all. In-room internet is reasonable at 6 € for 24 hours - but it is not Wi Fi. The rooms are clean and modern. The bathroom was full of marble and chrome; very clean and of a good size. There was just a hint of noise from the street below, but not enough to bother us. Room service from the restaurant, as well as from a Telepizza franchise is available - the food from both sources was only mediocre. The restaurant was adequate. They have a dinner buffet for 25 € which was too pricey for me. I had a few appetizers and then ordered a pizza to the room. I found the overall quality of accomodations to be similar to a Hampton Inn - plenty enough for my last night before flying home. Not sure why all the negative reviews. As I said, the Tryp must have been recently renovated because it is clean and sharp throughout the interior (much better than the cell block lock of the oexterior).

Reviews.Title: “1 Star Service at a 4Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was traveling through Spain with family and returned to Madrid the day before our flight home. As our flight was at 6 am, we booked a room at the Tryp Alameda near Barajas Airport. The hotel website says that they have a 24 hour shuttle to the airport and most hotels don't even start running their shuttles until 6 am. When we checked into the hotel, we were greeted by an extraordinarily rude desk clerk, who gave one word responses to my questions about arranging the shuttle. I kept at it, though, and eventually discerned that she would not arrange the shuttle for me - I must come down to the desk in the middle of the night and ask the night desk clerk to call the shuttle. Then I would have to wait in the lobby until it arrived. I could not get a good idea from her about how much time I needed to allow for the shuttle to arrive once called, so we decided to be downstairs by 3:30 am in order to be at the airport by 4:30. The room was nice enough, but the attention to detail was lacking. As an example, although the room was generally clean, the edges of the tub had mildew. There was no bath mat or wash cloth. There was no shampoo, only the shower gel. There is a speaker for the TV in the bathroom, which was nice, but the amenities weren't what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. We settled in to repack all of our belongings and try to figure out how to bring home all the things we had bought during our trip. The hotel has a restaurant that opens for dinner at 8:30 pm, but as our flight was so early, we wanted to have an early dinner and nap until 3 am or so. The room had a card for Telepizza, which says orders are delivered directly to your room, generally within 30 minutes, and can be billed to your room. That was exactly what we needed. The instructions said the front desk would place the order, so we called at 6:30 pm. A different desk clerk told us to call back after 8 pm or go to the Telepizza location in person. He said they would not take hotel orders before 8:00. So we called back at 8 pm and placed our order with the desk clerk. He said he would call it in and it should arrive in about 30 minutes. About 90 minutes later, we called back and the female desk clerk who had handled our check in answered. We asked if there was a problem with our order. She said we would have to wait a half hour. We explained that we had already waited an hour and a half. She said she would have someone call in our order now and we would have to wait a half hour for it to arrive. There was no apology for not having called in our order to begin with, just attitude when we told her not to bother at that point. We were not filled with confidence about having the shuttle in time for our flight. We were so angry at the rude treatment we were receiving at this supposed 4 star hotel that we refused to spend our money in their restaurant. We walked around the residential neighborhood and did find a small restaurant to have dinner. Back in our room, we tried to watch television for a while, but could not find channels that didn't freeze up and say there was a problem with the signal. When 3 am rolled around, we got up and brought all of our luggage downstairs to request the shuttle. Yet another rude desk clerk checked us out and we made sure to hear him call for the shuttle. The bus arrived quickly, but we were left to load our own bags. The driver dropped another passenger at terminal 4 and tried to get us to get out as well, although we had told him terminal 1. He did take us to our terminal, although it was an impossibly long trip from terminal 4 to terminal 1. When we arrived, he opened the back door and let us take out one of our own bags. The other one he grabbed and dropped on the ground without so much as a glance in our direction. Then he just turned his back on us and left. All in all, the convenience of the airport location and the 24 hour shuttle made our stay there necessary, and the room itself was nice. But those things are not enough to overcome the incredibly rude treatment by the hotel staff. In the same situation again, I would rather sleep in the airport terminal than stay in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with bad front staff”
Reviews.Author: life43
Reviews.Content: While travelling in Europe for a month with my daughter, we stayed in three Melia hotels. In Sevilla and Granada everything was excellent. However, the experience at the Tryp Alameda was quite different, due to the following incident: The day before our arrival I called up from Paris in order to find out what were the steps to get the shuttle service at the airport. They told me to ring up as soon as we arrived and they would send a shuttle. I did so and they asked to explain exactly the place where we would be waiting. I gave the exact location (the taxi cabs stop) as requested. After waiting for about 30 minutes, we called back again and they said not to move from we had been waiting. We saw the shuttle speeding up twice without giving us time to call it. We called to the hotel two more times and again we were told to wait at the same spot. We wanted to take a taxi but we were told that there was a shuttle stop. We went there but dindn´t find the hotel shuttle so we returned to the place. Finally, we saw the shuttle and ran with the lugagge to the shuttle stop and could take it. If we had been told there was a shuttle station we wouldn not had to wait, tired, for more than 90 minutes outside at night, without a seat. We lost precious time we could have used to rest since we were going to take a 15 hour flight early the morning after. We finally got at the hotel at around 11 pm, but what made things worse was that no one apologized or said anything about it. We felt very disappointed! Something else we didn´t like about their accomodation was that we had to carry our luggage through a 6 or 7 step stairs in our way to the lift and up in the morning before leaving the hotel. I hope those stairs will be redesigned since the hotel is being refurbished. Regarding the room, everything was great: spacious, confortable beds, cozy lights, beautiful and convenient bathroom. The toileteries were first quality. We had a good dine with very polite staff. As I have Mas Card, we had the newspaper in the morning and enjoyed a delicious buffet breakfast 2 por the price of 1. The front desk staff was kind in the morning and the shuttle to airport was very punctual. I could come back to this hotel because of its very good fares and excellent rooms, and going to the shuttle stop!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 1 night in Feb 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp Alameda for one night, as we had an early flight out of the Barajas airport. Although the lobby is dingey and mediocre (& the elevators a bit dodgey...we took the stairs after the first ride), the rooms were fabulous. We had very comfortable beds (new mattresses, we checked!), loads of extra pillows and a clean room. The bathroom was great. The additional door between the outside hallway and the bedroom was a nice feature to ensure a quiet night. We didn't eat at the hotel, but reception recommended some great places around the corner. The free shuttle to the airport leaves every 15 minutes; it's a great hotel that's too convenient to overlook.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Tourist Trap!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Alameda for one night on 17 December 2003. The rooms are nicely furnished and that is the only positive comment I can make about this hotel. Everything else is a complete disaster -1. The heating system in the room did not work. I'm told the heating level is adjusted with reference to the outside temperature. The room temperature must have been only a few degrees above that outside and I could not sleep all night.2. We had regular power outages all through the evening and I sat in total darkness at times for up to an hour.3. The restaurant is an absolute disgrace. The evening buffet had a hot section consisting of a few cold chicken bones. The waiter failed to turn on the heater to keep them warm. Service is "managed" to ensure that your stay at the table will be as brief as possible. Immediately you stand up to go for something extra the table is cleared.4. Breakfast service is again "managed" to get the tourists off to the airport ASAP. Only a few of the available tables are set for breakfast. This strategy ensures there will always be a line up for tables and those concerned about time will opt to head for the airport rather than wait.5. The bizzare situation concerning the elevator (does not stop at lobby) already noted by another reviewer is correct.Obviously the tourist traffic here changes every day. New faces arrive all the time and there is no incentive whatsoever to provide any service.

Reviews.Title: “near the airport and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the alameda tryp hotel everytime i am flying out of madrid the next day. the rooms are modern and quiet. they offer free bottled water in the room. the bathrooms are marble and clean. they offer internet service downstairs for a modest fee. the buffet breakfast is just o.k., but they do have a variety of food items. the only sucky thing is that they don't have a ramp leading down to the elevator, so you have to lug your luggage down the stairs. also, the elevator only fits 2 average sized americans. the elevator is the only thing totally out of date. don't eat dinner here, walk to the little bars and cafes nearby or the jamoneria which is next to the hotel. the shuttle to the airport is always at your disposal at any time.

HotelInfo.Name: Tryp Alameda Aeropuerto
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida de Logrono 100, 28042 Madrid, Spain
